sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An elegy on the [right honourable] Anthony Earl of Shaftsbury, Who dyed on the 21st. of January, 1683.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
[s.n.], London, : Printed anno Domini, MDCLXXXIII. [1683]
Includes: [An] elegy [on the death of (the] much to be lamented) Anthony K. of Poland.; [a Tory satire on Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of Shafte]sbury. First verse - "The busie statemen who by toyle unblest,"; second verse - "THe busie Toney, who by Toil unblest".; the first poem matches Wing E434A. Identified as Wing (2nd ed.) E436 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2124.3. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

Includes: [An] elegy [on the death of (the] much to be lamented) Anthony K. of Poland.; [a Tory satire on Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of Shafte]sbury. First verse - "The busie statemen who by toyle unblest,"; second verse - "THe busie Toney, who by Toil unblest".; the first poem matches Wing E434A. Identified as Wing (2nd ed.) E436 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2124.3. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
